result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Sentence Component Probation
Letter Recieved Requesting Expungement
Per SCR 72, documents have been optically imaged and file destroyed.

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Brandon A Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 17.

COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case spun to Bracnh 6, Court in trial on another matter.
FILED, REQUEST FOR PROBATIONARY SENTENCE WITH NO JAIL TIME AND EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF SUPERVISION
Copy of Request for Probationary Sentence With No Jail Time And Expungement Upon Successful Completion of Supervision with attached letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense move to withdraw motion. Court in jury trial on another matter. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 09-15-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from ADA Hauer received and filed. tk
FILED, STATE'S RESPONSE TO DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO SUPRESS PHYSICAL AND DERIVATIVE EVIDENCE

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea hearing. Defense requests case set for a motion hearing. Response due no later than 07-31-2015 by 5:00 pm. Case adjourned for motion hearing on 08-04-2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.  Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310. Motion hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Suppress Physical and Derivative Evidence received and filed. tk

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Danielle Chojnacki for Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel has proposed a DPA and is waiting for a response, and requested an adjournment.  Court granted the defense request for an adjournment. Court extended the deadline to file any motions until the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons placed on the record, case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing, br. 17. Any motions due has been extended to be due no later than 06-17-2015 at 8:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Christopher D. Donovan.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Case is scheduled for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 6-5-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Any motions due no later than 6-5-2015 by 8:30 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Christopher D. Donovan.  Ron Dague for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is currently assigned to Judge Fiorenza per the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney and approval of the Court.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Christopher D. Donovan.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has retained attorney Donovan.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing on 3/31/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch PE.  Court reminds defendant to not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defendant advised the court he is retaining private counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 3  Status conference scheduled for 03-13-2015 at 08:30 am.
Memorandum from the Public Defender's office, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court with attorney Amy C Scholz as a friend of the Court.  Patricia Daugherty for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM008522  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-18-2015
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua E Perez in court (as friend of the court) with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 3.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 02-20-2015 at 01:30pm
